files.patch: @@ -119,2 +119,2 @@ - * Double#equals equals} uses representation - * equivalence, defining NaN arguments to be equal to each other, + * Double#equals equals} uses {@linkplain ##repEquivalence representation + * equivalence}, defining NaN arguments to be equal to each other, @@ -592,0 +592,4 @@ + * @apiNote + * This method corresponds to the convertToDecimalCharacter + * operation defined in IEEE 754. + * @@ -672,0 +676,5 @@ + * + * @apiNote + * This method corresponds to the convertToHexCharacter operation + * defined in IEEE 754. + * @@ -898,0 +907,4 @@ + * @apiNote + * This method corresponds to the convertFromDecimalCharacter and + * convertFromHexCharacter operations defined in IEEE 754. + * @@ -1088,0 +1101,1 @@ + @Override @@ -1101,0 +1115,1 @@ + @Override @@ -1113,0 +1128,1 @@ + @Override @@ -1125,0 +1141,1 @@ + @Override @@ -1142,0 +1159,1 @@ + @Override @@ -1151,0 +1169,1 @@ + @Override @@ -1211,3 +1230,2 @@ - * relation must be implemented; see this discussion for details of - * floating-point equality and equivalence. + * relation must be implemented; see {@linkplain ##equivalenceRelation + * this discussion for details of floating-point equality and equivalence}. @@ -1390,3 +1408,3 @@ - * equals; see this - * discussion for details of floating-point comparison and - * ordering. + * equals; see {@linkplain ##equivalenceRelation this + * discussion for details of floating-point comparison and + * ordering}. @@ -1406,0 +1424,1 @@ + @Override

@@ -308,0 +308,4 @@ + * @apiNote + * This method corresponds to the convertToDecimalCharacter + * operation defined in IEEE 754. + * @@ -388,0 +392,5 @@ + * + * @apiNote + * This method corresponds to the convertToHexCharacter operation + * defined in IEEE 754. + * @@ -525,0 +534,4 @@ + * @apiNote + * This method corresponds to the convertFromDecimalCharacter and + * convertFromHexCharacter operations defined in IEEE 754. + * @@ -730,0 +743,1 @@ + @Override @@ -743,0 +757,1 @@ + @Override @@ -755,0 +770,1 @@ + @Override @@ -767,0 +783,1 @@ + @Override @@ -776,0 +793,1 @@ + @Override @@ -793,0 +811,1 @@ + @Override @@ -840,3 +859,2 @@ - * relation must be implemented; see this discussion for - * details of floating-point equality and equivalence. + * relation must be implemented; see {@linkplain Double##equivalenceRelation + * this discussion for details of floating-point equality and equivalence}. @@ -1093,1 +1111,1 @@ - * The binary16 format is discussed in + * The {@linkplain ##binary16Format binary16 format} is discussed in @@ -1209,3 +1227,3 @@ - * equals; see this - * discussion for details of floating-point comparison and - * ordering. + * equals; see {@linkplain Double##equivalenceRelation this + * discussion for details of floating-point comparison and + * ordering}. @@ -1226,0 +1244,1 @@ + @Override
